title: Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Value-Added Tax Consolidation Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Value-Added Tax Consolidation Act 

2010 (section 46(5)) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited value-added tax consolidation act 2010 (section 46(5)) order 2022

title: Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of
heading: 2. Subclause (ii) of paragraph 11(4)(a) of Schedule 2 to the Value-Added
text_raw:
2. Subclause (ii) of paragraph 11(4)(a) of Schedule 2 to the Value-Added 
Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of 
“30 June 2022” for “31 December 2021”.
text_norm: 2 subclause (ii) paragraph 11(4)(a) schedule 2 value-added tax consolidation act 2010 (no 31 2010) amended substitution 30 june 2022 31 december 2021

title: Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of
heading: 3. This Order shall be deemed to have come into operation on 1 January
text_raw: 3. This Order shall be deemed to have come into operation on 1 January
text_norm: 3 order shall deemed come operation 1 january

title: Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of
heading: GIVEN under my Official Seal,
text_raw:
2022. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

12 December, 2022. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th December, 2022.

title: Tax Consolidation Act 2010 (No. 31 of 2010) is amended by the substitution of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Order extends the application of the zero rate of VAT to certain goods 
used in the delivery of Covid-19 related health care services, from 31 
December 2021 to 30 June 2022. The zero rate of VAT will continue to apply 
to the supply of personal protection equipment, thermometers, hand sanitiser, 
oxygen, medical ventilators and specialist respiratory equipment including 
respirators for intensive and sub-intensive care and other oxygen therapy 
apparatus including oxygen tents, where such goods are supplied to the HSE, 
hospitals, nursing homes, care homes and GP practices, for use in the delivery 
of Covid-19 related health care services to their patients. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [665]
